page.title: 19The Registrar's Office.
page.content: The Registrar's Office is situated in Manse Road opposite the school. It was built 50 years ago. Two people work there now. They open at 9.00am and close at 4.45pm. To work there you have to be good at typing, arithmetic, and English. The officers have to register births, deaths and marriages which take place in the area. Local inhabitants go to the office to pay their rent and rates.This year there have been 24 marriages in the village, 4 of which were held in the office.The office is closed during the marriage ceremony and is made pretty by decorating the room with flowers.There have been altogether 54 deaths and 18 christnings in Thornhill this year. The rent goes up in price every April.
